intro: Hornstedtia triloba, commonly known as the three-lobed hornstedtia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
